info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Schenectady, Saratoga, southern Washington, northern Rensselaer and northwestern Bennington Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Salem to Rock City Falls. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Clifton Park, Saratoga Springs, Scotia, Mechanicville, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Salem, Niskayuna, Ballston Spa, Shaftsbury, Cambridge, Greenwich, Round Lake, Galway, East Glenville, Burnt Hills, Rock City Falls, Country Knolls and North Ballston Spa. People attending Saratoga Performing Arts Center (SPAC) should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes the following highways... Interstate 890 between exits 4b and 4c. Interstate 87 between exits 8A and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
